*div1 type="summary"* *p*A. C. Taylor to Austin, Rushville, Ill., February 19, 1831, Asking conditions of settlement in Texas. A number of families wish to move to milder climate. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
[Indorsed by Austin: Ansd Feb 28.]
*p*A. C. Taylor to Austin*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Rushville, Schuyler Co Illinois*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="02-19-1831">Feb. 19, 1831.*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr. Sir*/p*
*p*Without the honor of being known to you, I have flattered myself that the nature of the subject of this communication will be some excuse for the liberty I have taken in trespassing a few moments on your attention.*/p*
*p*There are in this vicinity, a number of *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*who are desirous of removing to a *location_mentioned*southern climate*/location_mentioned*; and on my suggesting to them that the country of the *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*afforded very considerable inducements, I have been requested to procure, if possible, further, and more recent information in regard to that *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. I have therefore been induced to solicit this information, sir from you, not being acquainted with any person resident in that *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*We are apprised that it has heretofore been the practice to give to every actual *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*a certain quantity of land—we would be glad to know whether this practice is still continued—in your own tract of *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and if not, whether it is the case in other parts of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and if so what quantity of land is now given and what will be the expense of procuring the deed and the survey, and whether there are good and convenient *location_mentioned*tracts of country*/location_mentioned* yet unappropriated. If land is not given at this time in any part of the *location_mentioned*province*/location_mentioned*, on what terms can it be purchased ?—What is the face of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*—how watered, and how furnished with building materials? What are the advantages in a commercial point of view and what are the productions of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*? What are the religious priveleges—-are there many wealthy *person_mentioned*inhabitants*/person_mentioned*—and is slavery now tolerated ?—All accounts that we have received concur in representing the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*as healthy, still I should be glad to know what encouragement a *person_mentioned*physician */person_mentioned*would be likely to meet with.*/p*
*p*I have acquainted myself pretty extensively with the culture and manufacture of the grape, and have had some practical experience in that business, I am therefore anxious to know whether the soil and climate of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*is adapted to its successful cultivation, I should be glad also to be informed whether as yet the silk-worm has been introduced into the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Some with whom I have conversed on the subject of removing have expressed fears in regard to the *person_mentioned*indians*/person_mentioned*—please to say something in dissipation of such fears, if they are groundless.*/p*
*p*There are about a Dozen *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*here who will probably remove *date_mentioned n="Fall-1831">next fall*/date_mentioned* if satisfied in regard to the state and coditions of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and many more will remove the following season if pleased with their accounts of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Please to send us, if convenient, a copy of the constitution of your general government, and one for the *location_mentioned*province*/location_mentioned*, if you have a separate constitution, as we do in the *location_mentioned*States*/location_mentioned*; and also a copy of your code of laws, as those interested, are anxious to obtain all the information possible in regard to your civil institutions.*/p*
*p*The above, together with any other information, whether written or printed you may please to send us? will be thankfully received as a very special favor by*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*A. C. Taylor */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. —— Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*P. S. I do not know the regulations of the*location_mentioned* Post office*/location_mentioned*, but any expenses incurred in that line will be very cheerfully met by*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*A. C. T*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] Col. Austin, of *location_mentioned*Austin Town St, Philip de Austin Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
